data.text:
“It is undeniable that fewer people are visiting physical vendors to settle their bills when they can conveniently do so online. This app capitalizes on that trend, and I am optimistic about its future success and widespread acceptance.”

Linus Williams Ifejika, popularly known as BLord, a Nigerian tech pioneer and cryptocurrency investor, has turned down a generous $10 million funding offer from foreign investors for his latest creation, the BillPoint app.

The founder of the B-Lord Group, a leading fintech firm that has diversified into various industries, believes that the app holds immense profit potential and is confident that it will outperform the offered sum within a few years.

YOU CAN ALSO READ: Afrihealth Launches Rigour+: Cutting-Edge Medical Super App Revolutionizing African Healthcare

In an official statement released by his media office, BLord explained how the BillPoint mobile app is revolutionizing modern payment methods. Launched in April 2023, the app aims to simplify the process of paying electricity and cable TV bills for Nigerians.

“The BillPoint app is here to make transactions easy for Nigerians,” said BLord. “It is undeniable that fewer people are visiting physical vendors to settle their bills when they can conveniently do so online. This app capitalizes on that trend, and I am optimistic about its future success and widespread acceptance.”

BLord further revealed that the app has already garnered significant attention and generated substantial revenue within days of its launch. He believes this early success serves as evidence of the app’s value and anticipates that it will solve numerous problems for users in the near future.

YOU CAN ALSO READ: Baobab+Nigreia: Kola Osinowo’s Vision For Future of Energy, Digital Transformation

BillPoint, developed by the BLord Group as a response to the challenges traditional banks faced with small transactions such as subscription payments and recurring utility bills, offers a secure, user-friendly platform for online bill payments.

The service is integrated with over 30 service providers, providing a convenient and reliable solution for consumers.

BLord’s firm, the B-Lord Group, has experienced remarkable growth over the years, expanding into real estate and other sectors.

With the development of the BillPoint app, BLord aims to address the pain points associated with bill payments and contribute to the digital transformation of financial services in Nigeria.
